p: With regards to the introduction of infected hosts, this is also modelled stochastically with a fixed migration rate (of infected individuals) per year, which is varied between the sensitivity scenarios presented in Figure 4. In effect, different simulations with the same migration rate will experience introduction events at different time points. The mean and variation presented in the stochastic model output ( Figure 4) represent the outcome of thousands of simulations and therefore include all possible scenarios in which introductions may have occurred, covering periods of both high and low R e / R 0 .
